markdownRemark.html:
I am Software Engineer who is coding since 2012, working onsite as well as remotely. In some aspect I identify myself with Dan Abramov’s tagline “Junior Developer for Life” because I am always willing to improve myself and go for the extra mile. I have been participating on a wide diversity of projects, from researching in IXA taldea to comercial software development for eCommerces, always trying to give the 100% and create good atmosphere and team cohesion.

These last years I have worked mostly with JavaScript in both backend and frontend, but most of the time in the front. I have worked with Angular, Vue and React, being the last the one I know and like the most. Currently, in my everyday job I work with TypeScript, React, Redux, Jest, Enzyme and React-Testing-lib.

Anyway, I consider myself as a t-shaped developer and I like to be aware of and contribute on other aspects of the project I am working on. Thus, I like to give a hand also in the backend, check some CI/CD pipelines or help with the definition of our user-stories. In addition, I have been working following Extreme Programming and Agile principles with Scrum, with 2 week long sprints working in squads formed by 4 to 6 mates.

Also I have become a Theegg.ai student, which is a new disrupted school to deep dive into AI. I think that Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence are game-changing technologies which are going to be key in the future. So I reckon that these need to be invested on and democratized for anybody who wants to work with them.

If you want to know more from me, here you can access my CV. Besides, if you need to contact me, you can send me an email or find me on twitter, github or linkedin.

Cheers ;-)
